subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Male and female voices joined to create one response?
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_5ca895a2-c7fe-44f4-88fa-0d5d9a18a14a_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Sharon,
 
The question of telekinesis is a valid one, I have discussed tha=
t idea with technical people
that are trying to further the technology.
 
M=
y belief is that if the researcher is able to recognise the tech's voice it=
 is because the 
researcher and the tech have built their relationship to t=
he point that they have synchronized 
their spiritual energy and the tech i=
s capable of finding and utilizing certain fragments of radio
speech and fr=
equency to create a recognizable voice. It does not necessarily have to be =
the voice 
they had in the physical, but I believe if they create the same =
voice during communication it is
a validation to us on the receiving end th=
at we are in fact speaking to our counterpart and not a deceiving
entity th=
at may be negative in manner.
 
Also my tech's do not 100% of the time have=
 the correct signal to create the recognizable voice and do 
answer or spea=
k in a different or combined voice. When that occurs they tend to reassure =
the researcher 
with a comfortable feeling and you instinctively know after=
 a certain period of communicating with the same 
tech/guide that it is in =
fact them that are speaking on the other hand you will also get a strange g=
ut reaction 
when it is not them speaking. That is the best way I know how =
to explain it as I have come to understand it.
 
I hope it helps further yo=
ur knowledge of the tech/researcher relationship.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 

=

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: leongbabe@...: Sat, 12 Jan 2008 0=
4:07:48 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Male and female voices joined to create=
 one response?




Hi Juli,Thanks for your input -- this is interesting -- =
could it be that Mike and Lisa use these fragments in conjunction with psyc=
ho-kinesis in order to modify the tone of these fragments to sound as their=
 own voices would have sounded when they were alive? We know they don't hav=
e vocal cords, and so they probably communicate via some kind of thought/mi=
nd process ... Not to say that all the entities employ this method, maybe s=
ome of the more identifiable ones like Mike and Lisa.I love mulling over th=
ings and this will keep me mulling for quite a long time.Sharon the Muller-=
-- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> wrote:=
>> Bruce, you may want to also add that when they wait for those fragments =
they are in fact Mike and Lisa's voice not just any male or female voice. T=
hey are ones that you identify as being theirs.> > Juli> > mllejade <leongb=
abe@...> wrote:> Thanks for the fast reply, Bruce! Definitely something to =
add to my > notes for further examination.> > Sharon> > --- In EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com, bruce halliday > <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:> >> > > > S=
haron,> > > > In my experience through research, most of the time mike will=
 wait > for a masculine fragment or signal> > and lisa will wait for a femi=
nine one. I believe they try to answer > in the apropriate gender so that I=
 > > don't get confused about who is answering. Sometimes I will get a > re=
sponse or message that is made > > up of both male and female voices togeth=
er, even in the same word > sometimes but very rarely.> > > > And I think w=
hen that occurs it's because they lose the particular > fragment midstream =
and pick up > > whatever is available at that instant to complete the messa=
ge , > word or phrase.> > > > I hope this answers your question and please =
keep asking them. It > forces me to formulate an answer> > and you to furth=
er your knowledge as a researcher. That's what it's > all about.> > > > Bru=
ce> > Bruce Halliday > > > > > > To: EVP-ITC@: leongbabe@: Fri, 11 Jan 2008=
 16:26:18 > +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Male and female voices joined to create=
 one > response?> > > > > > > > > > Bruce,Is it common to receive a respons=
e comprised of a mixture of > men and women sound bytes/voices (like I hear=
d in this one)? My guess > is that we hear predominantly male voices becaus=
e they're more male > radio announcers. Therefore, does the entity who anno=
unces herself to > you as Lisa come through with a male voice at times (bec=
ause those > are the voices that she gets most of the time to formulate a >=
 response)? Please tell me if my reasoning here is way off > base...Thanks,=
Sharon--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, EVP-> ITC@yahoogroups.com wrote:>> > =

Sharon,<BR>
 <BR>
The question of telekinesis is a valid o=
ne, I have discussed that idea with technical people<BR>
that are trying to=
 further the technology.<BR>
 <BR>
My belief is that if the resea=
rcher is able to recognise the tech's voice it is because the <BR>
research=
er and the tech have built their relationship to the point that they have s=
ynchronized <BR>
their spiritual energy and the tech is capable of finding =
and utilizing certain fragments of radio<BR>
speech and frequency to create=
 a recognizable voice. It does not necessarily have to be the voice <BR>
th=
ey had in the physical, but I believe if they create the same voice during =
communication it is<BR>
a validation to us on the receiving end that we are=
 in fact speaking to our counterpart and not a deceiving<BR>
entity that ma=
y be negative in manner.<BR>
 <BR>
Also my tech's do not 100% of the t=
ime have the correct signal to create the recognizable voice and do <BR>
an=
swer or speak in a different or combined voice. When that occurs they tend =
to reassure the researcher <BR>
with a comfortable feeling and you instinct=
ively know after a certain period of communicating with the same <BR>
tech/=
guide that it is in fact them that are speaking on the other hand you will =
also get a strange gut reaction <BR>
when it is not them speaking. That is =
the best way I know how to explain it as I have come to understand it.<BR>
=
 <BR>
I hope it helps further your knowledge of the tech/researcher re=
lationship.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR><BR>
